answers.answer: Hi,though there are possible treatments on the horizon, they are not likely to be widespread any time soon.I think the biggest advantages come with the modern insulins (which tend to be give more steady blood sugars), some of the new oral / injectable meds (which seem to be of great help) and the knowledge we have on how to use all these available tools and combine them with diet now, with much more of a move towards lower carb eating  (less carbs = less requirement for insulin - injected or by your own pancreas).For insulin resistance metformin is a helpful drug. Low carb diet and exercise (as much as you can - both strength and aerobic - how about swimming, stationary bike (properly set up may also be possible), rowing etc.) also help in management.
